title: Maksym Chekh
text:
Maksym Chekh (; born 3 January 1999) is a <a href="professional">professional</a> <a href="Ukraine">Ukrainian</a> <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a> who plays for <a href="FC%20Mariupol">FC Mariupol</a> in the <a href="Ukrainian%20Premier%20League">Ukrainian Premier League</a> on loan from <a href="FC%20Shakhtar%20Donetsk">Shakhtar Donetsk</a>.
Career.
Born in <a href="Velyka%20Novosilka%20Raion">Velyka Novosilka Raion</a> of the <a href="Donetsk%20Oblast">Donetsk Oblast</a>, Chekh is a product of Shakhtar Donetsk youth sportive school system.
He made his début for <a href="FC%20Mariupol">FC Mariupol</a> in the <a href="Ukrainian%20Premier%20League">Ukrainian Premier League</a> as a start squad player in the losing match against <a href="FC%20Kolos%20Kovalivka">FC Kolos Kovalivka</a> on 30 July 2019.
International career.
Chekh was part of the <a href="Ukraine%20national%20under-20%20football%20team">Ukraine national under-20 football team</a> that won the <a href="2019%20FIFA%20U-20%20World%20Cup">2019 FIFA U-20 World Cup</a>. He played one of the key roles in Ukraine's success, appearing in all 7 of his team's matches.
